Congratulations to all students who have completed their time receiving Post-High Transition Services this year in the Shawnee Mission School District.

Special educators a virtual ceremony to share with students who completed their time their time receiving Post-High Transitions Services. While it was disappointing to not gather in person, educators said they hoped the virtual celebration would be a memento students could look back on for years to come, Sherry Dumolien, special education director said.

Earlier this spring, JT Hawthorne reflected on his work experiences while in the Post-High Transition program for Inside Shawnee Mission School District magazine.

“The years I’ve been in this program have been incredible,” Hawthorne said. “It’s helped me make my decisions more clear about what I want to do in the future.”

March 31, 2020 Playground Update:

Due to the inability to obtain voluntary compliance with the request to stay off of school playgrounds (which included the posting of signs), all Shawnee Mission School District playgrounds are being closed and gates to school grounds will be locked. This is being done in an effort to reduce the transmission of the COVID-19 virus, and is consistent with guidelines from the Johnson County Department of Health and Environment.

Stadiums and athletic facilities in SMSD remain open, as long as everyone adheres to the following guidelines:

Personal distancing guidelines must be strictly adhered to (six feet of distance from any individual not in the same household)
No groups of more than 10 people
No team sports, including but not limited to:
Football
Basketball
Baseball
Soccer
Frisbee
The district will regularly monitor facilities to ensure compliance, and may revise these guidelines if necessary, in order to protect public health. Your cooperation is appreciated.

For the second consecutive year, Hocker Grove Middle School students won the districtwide middle school Battle of the Books tournament. This is the fifth year middle school library media specialists hosted the event for Shawnee Mission students. The event provides important opportunity for students to join as a team and experience friendly competition, Carol Edds, Hocker Grove library media specialist said.

“We strongly believe that it is important for students to be able to read for pleasure and this competition makes it even more enjoyable,” she said. “The experience improves reading and social skills and also teaches them the value of teamwork.”

Schools will be OPEN in the Shawnee Mission School District on Tuesday, December 17, 2019. We know that crews have been working hard to clear streets around our community, and our staff has worked to make sure that all our buildings are accessible. However, we have learned that some streets and parking lots around the community are still being cleared, and this could impact travel to school in the morning, particularly for our busses.

If your child rides the bus to and from school, please be aware that pick-up and drop-off times might be delayed. Consider signing up for the Textcaster late bus notification system, which alerts families via text when busses are delayed. You can sign up for Textcaster here: https://my.textcaster.com/asa/2795. If you have signed up for Textcaster and have confirmed your sign-up, you will receive a text in the event your child’s bus has been delayed.

We look forward to seeing your child at school in the morning, and for those of you who have teenagers driving to school in the morning, please remind them to drive slowly and be safe.

If your child rides the bus to and from school, please be aware that pick-up and drop-off times might be delayed. Consider signing up for the Textcaster late bus notification system, which alerts families via text when busses are delayed. You can sign up for Textcaster here: https://my.textcaster.com/asa/2795. If you have signed up for Textcaster and have confirmed your sign-up, you will receive a text in the event your child’s bus has been delayed.

We look forward to seeing your child at school in the morning, and for those of you who have teenagers driving to school in the morning, please remind them to drive slowly and be safe.
